meanings.definition: To fold or bend like a jackknife.
meanings.sent1: He was jackknifing the paper to make a paper airplane.
meanings.sent2: She watched as the acrobat jackknifed his body during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The magician's assistant tried jackknifing the giant playing card, but it didn't quite work.
meanings.sent4: The flexible gymnast seemed to effortlessly jackknife her body into a perfect split.
meanings.sent5: The origami artist demonstrated how to jackknife a piece of paper into a beautiful swan.

meanings.definition: To cause a vehicle to skid and swerve out of control.
meanings.sent1: The icy road conditions led to the truck jackknifing on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The reckless driver's sudden turn resulted in the car jackknifing dangerously.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's attempt at driving ended with him jackknifing the car into a tree.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds threatened to jackknife the sailboat off course.
meanings.sent5: The speeding car narrowly avoided jackknifing on the wet pavement.
